page.title: 02HOUSING IN TORRIDON
page.content: There are about 26{private houses,} about a third of which are{holiday houses,most of which are owned by English people.The houses in the oldest part of the village are{ {traditional croft}houses;one & half storey stone built,most of the stone is either covered with harling or paint. All have{Hydro electricity}and water,some get this from a private spring,some from the Mains supply.The drainage is to a{septic tank,}either a private one or the{County tank.The {Mains}which is the residence of the{NT warden,is one of the oldest buildings in the area.It has two foors plus an attic.The stone walls which are thick, are now painted white.Beside it is the {deer museum}and the former{Home Farm.} There are six{Council Houses}architect designed to blend into the village.The N.T.control all new building designs.
